title: My Google Pixel XL running Android Q has been stuck in a bootloop for over a day. Help?
content:
I've tried draining the battery and recharging the phone. I've gne int the bootloader but recovery mode (predictably) didn't work - it ust returns the phone to the bootloop. The only thing I can do through the bootloader is turn the device off. I have no idea what to do now.

I really hope Google - or just anyone really - can help, cause I don't have any active warranty and I'm not in the greatest financial position to consider buying a new device. I'm currently deeply regretting upgrading to android 10 if this was the outcome that awaited. 

P.S.
Please, Google, don't ask me to find an authorised Google repair center cause I don't believe such a thing exists within my country. I just need a way to get my phone back. I've only had it for ten months and that's not really enough time to establish as a lifespan for any phone.
